pr_title: Add unit tests for JVM decider

timeline.message: Add unit tests for JVM decider

timeline.bodyText: What happens when there are more than 2 workload type. If we dont want them in a list, can we use numbers to denote their priority? Also can you update the comment if we are changing it
timeline.author: sruti1312
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -26,7 +24,8 @@
  *     // Decreasing order of priority for the type of workload we can expect on the cluster.
  *     // Priority order in the list goes from most expected to the lease expected workload type.
  *     "workload-type": {
- *       "priority-order": ["ingest", "search"]
+ *       "prefer-ingest": true,
+ *       "prefer-search": false

replies.bodyText:
I actually had a discussion with Vigya on this in my previous PR. The problem with setting workload as a list is we have to maintain the string parsing logic inside the Config object and the priority list does not allow customer to specify the scenario if both search/ingest are equally important to customer or if customer simply don't have any preference.
So we created two options here instead so that customer can explicitly specific whether search/ingest is preferable.
The comments has been updated in the WorkLoaderConfig.java
replies.author: rguo-aws

timeline.bodyText:
step count will be a part of cacheSettingConfig right? Is there a reason why we are moving to actionConfig?
Will it be common parameter for cache and queue?
timeline.author: sruti1312

replies.bodyText: step count is indeed part of the cacheSettingConfig. But here we need to pass the parent Map<> object as a parameter in the constructor of the Config class
replies.author: rguo-aws

timeline.author: sruti1312

timeline.bodyText: We might need to update this comment right?
timeline.author: sruti1312
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -26,7 +24,8 @@
  *     // Decreasing order of priority for the type of workload we can expect on the cluster.
  *     // Priority order in the list goes from most expected to the lease expected workload type.

timeline.bodyText: This is confusing. I notice you have changed to use actionConfig. In that case this should be outside queue-settings block right?
timeline.author: sruti1312

replies.bodyText: this is the step count to divide the range of queue size into steps. We can specify different step count in cache if we want to have different granularity
replies.author: rguo-aws

timeline.bodyText:
As we are using this in test, can we rename to DeciderActionParserUtil or put it under util folder?
This can avoid confusion between src files and test files
timeline.author: sruti1312

replies.bodyText: good point. Let me rename this class
replies.author: rguo-aws

timeline.bodyText:
As per your comment
step count is indeed part of the cacheSettingConfig. But here we need to pass the parent Map<> object as a parameter in the constructor of the Config class
In that case this step count might need to be inside the cache-settings block right?
timeline.author: sruti1312
